humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, the patient has metastases carcinomatosae in 3 out of 23 assessed axillary lymph nodes (No III/XXIII). Based on the new rules provided, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for axillary lymph node metastasis is determined by the number of positive lymph nodes. In this report, it is stated that metastases carcinomatosae were found in 3 out of 23 (III/XXIII) axillary lymph nodes. This corresponds to an N2 stage (metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes or in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastasis).
